sentence: we did what central banks have done for many years and what they were designed to do: we served as a source of liquidity and stability in financial markets, and, in the broader economy, we worked to foster economic recovery and price stability.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: in response to the panic of 2008, the federal reserve has returned to its roots by restoring financial stability as a central objective alongside the traditional goals of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: we have also had to be innovative in finding ways to use monetary policy to help the economy recover from the deep recession that followed the crisis.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: providing adequate monetary accommodation has not been a straightforward task because our principal monetary policy tool, the target for the federal funds rate, has been stuck near zero since the end of 2008.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: consequently, we've had to find other ways to bring monetary policy to bear, notably including techniques designed to influence longer-term interest rates.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: for instance, the fed, like several other central banks, has purchased longer-term securities to put downward pressure on longer-term interest rates, help ease financial conditions, and promote a stronger recovery.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: part of that effort has involved formally defining our goals under the mandate for maximum employment and price stability given to us by the congress.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: two years ago, we established 2 percent as our inflation goal, and we regularly communicate policymakers' views of the level of unemployment expected to correspond to maximum sustainable employment over time.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: additionally, our monetary policy has come to rely more heavily on "forward guidance."
label: LABEL_0

sentence: as i already noted, improved communication can help our policies work better, whether through the disclosure of bank stress-test results or by helping the public and market participants better understand how monetary policy is likely to evolve.
label: LABEL_2
